|rad3oui = |rad3_ant_conn = |rad3txchains = 4 |rad3rxchains = 4 |rad3sstreams = 4 |rad3stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad3ac = 1733 |nqam3 = 600 |rad3n = 450 |rad3a = 54 |rad3freq = 5 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== {{See also|Winstars}} '''Model Difference Statement''': "We would like to confirm the models: :• ''WS-WN536A8, WS-WN533A8'', ARK T6, Quantum Max, Quantum T10, Quantum T12, :• Quantum D4C, Quantum D4, Quantum D6Q, Quantum D6, Quantum T8, Quantum T6 :are same in all respects. Only the model name and appearance is different. :The model ''WS-WN536A8'' is the tested sample." ==Links of Interest== '''Trick discovered to enable telnet on Wavlink WS-WN536A8 factory firmware Hardware local router address'''

http://192.168.10.1/webcmd.shtml

Once you are on this page type telnetd into the command box and press the apply button. nothing will show up in the lower box as a reply but if you port scan the device you will find port 2323 is now open for telnet. '''The default login=admin password=admin'''


https://forum.openwrt.org/t/trick-discovered-to-enable-telnet-on-wavlink-wl-wn570ha1-factory-firmware/49342


'''BACKDOOR Unauthenticated RCE – CVE-2020-10971 and CVE-2020-10972'''

'''Devices regarding:'''
JETSTREAM AC3000 aka ERAC3000 WS-WN536A8, WS-WN533A8, ARK T6, Quantum Max, Quantum T10, Quantum T12, Quantum D4C, Quantum D4, Quantum D6Q, Quantum D6, Quantum T8, Quantum T6

https://james-clee.com/2020/04/18/multiple-wavlink-vulnerabilities/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K-o0U8sQh-c&t=13s
